title: Planet Keen: The Commander Keen News Site
content:
[url=http://www.planetkeen.com/][img]http://www.planetkeen.com/images/logo.png[/img][/url]

Here it is, [url=http://www.planetkeen.com]planetkeen.com[/url]. A website I've had in the works for nearly a year. Its main purpose is to provide a summary of the interesting things that happen in the Keen community, particularly the PCKF and K:M, filling the gaps left by existing sites.

My hope is that it makes things easier for Keen fans who may not have the time to keep up with the forums, as well as non-Keeners who are curious about what we're up to but don't want to wade through hundreds of posts to find the stuff that interests them.

The 'Teleporter' link column on the left will also help us keep track of the myriad Keen sites scattered about the Interweb. See [url=http://p098.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumother.showMessage?topicID=2557.topic]this topic[/url] if you can contribute some link images. I'm adhering to an 88x31 link button system to keep things neat and interesting.

I've given administrative powers to KeenRush and Grafix, two Keeners whom I trust implicitly. Their task is to extract news from the PCKF and Keen:Modding as it comes up, and generally keep things running smoothly. Hopefully they'll have enough time between them to ensure regular updates, but I may be needing one more yet. I'm leaving for a two-week holiday in two days, so I'm interested to see how self-sufficient it can be.

There is a discussion [url=http://p098.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumother.showMessage?topicID=2556.topic]here[/url] asking what you all consider news. It would be helpful to hear some more feedback there, but I'm sure over time it should become self-evident.

I don't know for sure what to expect of this site yet, though there's a lot more I plan to do with it. Do let me know what could do with improvement, or other features you'd like to see down the track.

Above all, enjoy!

title: Re: Planet Keen: The Commander Keen News Site
content:
That site looks so-so to me. Good design, bad colour scheme. Even though it's all Keenish colours, you might want to reconsider on the combination of colours and the harshness. Like using the brown or dark grey backgrounds from Keen instead of that blue one.____________
Don't see me as an ordinary man.
Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]
Oh, and [url=http://www.tengusoft.net/]Team[/url].

title: Re: Planet Keen: The Commander Keen News Site
content:
Indeed, that's been suggested by a couple of people, though the majority so far have said it looks fine as-is. I'll experiment with colours sometime. For now it stays like this (unless grafix gets bored and decides to play with the colours while I'm out).

Thanks for the useful feedback, anyway!

title: Re: Planet Keen: The Commander Keen News Site
content:
The text is also kinda big. If it was a little smaller, you could fit more stuff onto the page, without having a lot to scroll through.
Also, I think the dates would be easier to read if they were dd-mm-yyyy of mm-dd-yyyy, instead of yyyy-mm-dd, since I'd rather know the date something happened than the year.

Oh, and nice logo. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] -Genius314

title: Re: Planet Keen: The Commander Keen News Site
content:
What size is it showing up as? I don't think I actually specified a size, and it just so happens to show up as I want it to on my browser. Must tweak that.

I've become accustomed to the international YYYY-MM-DD format, so that feels most comfortable to me. However, it's probably a good plan to change it to something more commonly accepted. How about "Month DD, YYYY" (ie. September 01, 2007)?

[hr]Genius Oh, and nice logo. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]
[hr]Cheers. Gotta love sudden inspiration.

title: Re: Planet Keen: The Commander Keen News Site
content:
dd-mm-yyyy is good for Spanish speaking people, or perhaps other languages. In spanish that's the usual format.

However, mm-dd-yyyy is the English standard and is recognized by most people around the world.

And more, yyyy-mm-dd is ideal for any language (almost), as it combines the formers mentioned above.------------------------------

Edit: Also, seems I misunderstood you, I thought you had a link banner for TGMM -- but it seems not, so I'll make one soon.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Lies!
content: [quote]Quote:[hr]However, mm-dd-yyyy is the English standard and is recognized by most people around the world.[hr][/quote]That's not actually true - the US and Canada are the only English-speaking countries that use the mm/dd/yyyy date format. (It is also used in Austria, the Philippines and Micronesia, but nowhere else.)

title: Re: Lies!
content:
I supposed wrong as in English long dates go as "July 14th 2004", that is, the Month before the Day and Year.------------------------------

title: Re: Lies!
content:
And in Canada it's not even proper. Any official or commercial document lists the date dd-mm-yyyy or the opposite. mm-dd-yyyy is used in common writings but not consistently. It gets rather annoying actually.

Back on topic, it has the potential to be a very good site. I'm looking forward to using it when I get lost in the pack. Hopefully you can keep it up.--------------------

title: Re: Lies!
content:
You should link directly to images and files instead of just dumping a link to a pckf topic. That ruins the whole purpose of your site because if I want a news summary I'd not want to search complete topics for information It might even be better to show some images in the news posts.

A simple comment system might also be handy for users without an account on the pckf.

title: Re: Lies!
content:
The new news post is an excellent example of a news message written in the wrong way.
It appears like its aimed only on the PCKF members. It also doesnt bother to quote Tom instead it just dumps a link to a topic where one has to look for some image with the e-mail of Tom Hall.

I also wonder how Keen fans are ever supposed to this fan site. Nobody even bothered to put a link on Wikipedia, the PCKF, or whatever place. This and the lack of response to the critics makes it appears to me like another doomed attempt to revive the Keen fanbase.
-----------------

title: style
content:
Have you ever relied on any blog-style news sources? A good example of one recently would be the [url=http://www.smashbros.com]new Super Smash Bros. Brawl[/url] website. The whole thing is done in blog style... it's kind of fun, actually.

It's difficult to write a truly unbiased article, especially in this sensitive day and age--making the site update in a more personal, notes/diary/blog style makes sense, as it's faster to do and (arguably) more entertaining to read.

I'm sorry you don't like it, Djaser. :P
